item.title: How to better manage and eliminate state without Redux
item.description: When I started writing React – I made a big mess. Many of my components took too many props, or my component had an immense amount of state. Doing simple things required a lot of data manipulation, and ultimately led to a lot of bugs. It didn’t take long for simple tasks to become extremely tedious. I think this happens to a lot of people who start out with React.
